did.unittitle: Philadelphia Orthopaedic Hospital and Infirmary for Nervous Diseases records

bioghist.p: The Philadelphia Orthopaedic Hospital was established in 1867. In 1870, an Infirmary for Nervous Diseases was added. The hospital was established to treat patients with bodily deformities or diseases of the nervous system. It accepted charity and paying patients and also treated, at daily clinics, patients not requiring admission. The hospital opened at 15 South 9th Street, and later moved to the northwest corner of 17th and Summer streets. In 1938, the Philadelphia Orthopaedic Hospital and Infirmary for Nervous Diseases merged with the University of Pennsylvania and became part of the University Hospital. After the merger, the 17th and Summer streets facility was assumed by the Doctors' Hospital.

scopecontent.p: This is a volume of staff meeting minutes, 1891-1927. Minutes document periodic meetings of the staff to discuss various hospital matters, including appointments, fees, facilities and space usage, and pay for staff. Includes some discussion of the establishment of a Psychopathic Clinic, a course for Massage and Electricity, and opening a ward for private pediatric patients.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
